abstract: The company’s shares have lost 25 percent of their value in the last year, compared with a 37 percent drop on the Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index.
snippet: The company’s shares have lost 25 percent of their value in the last year, compared with a 37 percent drop on the Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index.
lead_paragraph: Exxon Mobil, the world’s largest publicly traded oil company, reported its lowest quarterly profits in nearly six years on Thursday as lower oil prices slashed earnings across the industry.

headline.main: Lower Oil Prices Reduce Exxon’s Quarterly Profit
headline.print_headline: Lower Oil Prices Reduce Exxon’s Quarterly Profit
